description:
We use 'qemu-img snapshot' when taking a snapshot and this assumes the disk image is qcow2.

So, if you set the use_cow_images option to False and try and snapshot a guest running on a raw image, you get:

    kwargs['instance_uuid'], e, sys.exc_info())

  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/exception.py", line 117, in wrapped

comments.content:
Hi Mark, 

I took a look at this bug and wasn't able to reproduce it: I set 'use_cow_images=false' at nova.conf, then I created an instance and did the snapshot without problems.

Checking the logs I noticed that the libvirt.xml of the instance contains '<driver name="qemu" type="qcow2" cache="none"/>' on the disk section. So looks like another bug preventing us to see this one.

So could you please check if this problem still happens? Am I missing some step? 

Thanks
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~maurosr

comments.content: It still happens, because current snapshotting essentially is simple "qemu-img snapshot -c" command which can't work with anything except qcow2. Furthermore, this command is taken on suspended instance, so basically there are no problem at all to do simple "cp" for raw, and upload taken copy to glance. Even more, I can't understand why this is snapshotting at all, because essentially - this is image creating on suspended instance. For example, in EC2 API this action referred as "create image", not snapshot.
